page.title: 02Londonderry Junction.
page.content: This railway junction got its name from the third Marquess of Londonderry.Through his marriage in 1819 to Lady Frances Anne Vane Tempest the family became owners of collieries near Durham City.The third Marquess built the Londonderry Railway which ran from Seaham to Sunderland;this was a fully equipped line carrying passengers and goods traffic.The line stayed private family property until 1900,then it was taken over by the North Eastern Railway.Today,only coal trains run along this line;each day between 50 and 60 trains pass the junction carrying coal fro Seaham collieries.One signalman works the junction,he routes each train safely on the right track.The coal is taken to the South Dock where is tipped onto ships heading for power stations in the south of England.
